cause.description:
Our Goals:
To raise awareness in the media of digital rights abuses To provide a media clearinghouse, connecting journalists with experts and activists To preserve and extend traditional civil liberties in the digital world To collaborate with other digital rights and related organisations To nurture a community of campaigning volunteers, from grassroots activists to technical and legal experts
November 2007: For a limited time only, Joseph Rowntree Reform Trust is matching each extra pound we raise with another free pound of their own. That means they double your money! Please consider giving a little extra, to help us make the most of this generous offer.
DO NOT donate here; Causes won't send the money to ORG as it's not a US charity. Instead use this page:
https://secure.openrightsgroup.org/support/
1. Government databases must be constrained
2. DRM destroys value - we oppose it
3. Net Neutrality - mere conduit status preserved
4. Computerised voting is insecure, opaque and badly designed; it destroys trust in the democratic process
cause.mission: Protect Digital Rights in the UK and Europe
